coursetitle: Physiotherapy Posting in General & Cardiothoracic Surgery and Oncology
topics: History taking from patients with cancer and those who have had surgery
Physical examination of patients with cancer and those who have had surgery
Assessment procedures for patients with cancer and those who have had surgery
Clinical reasoning and making clinical judgments
Communication of management plans and information with patients
Management and evaluation of patients who have had surgery and those with cancer
objectives: Take history, carry out physical examination, and other relevant assessment procedures on patients with cancer and those who have had surgery
Demonstrate skills in clinical reasoning and making clinical judgments
Demonstrate skills in communicating management plans and other information with patients
Demonstrate skills in managing and evaluating patients who have had surgery and those with cancer
aim: PST501 is a clinical posting that provides students with practical experience in working with patients who have undergone general surgery and those with cancer. Students will learn to conduct comprehensive history taking, physical examination, and relevant assessment procedures for these patient populations. Additionally, students will develop skills in clinical reasoning, making clinical judgments, and communicating treatment plans effectively to patients. By the end of the posting, students will be proficient in managing and evaluating patients in these clinical settings.

Demonstrate skills in communicating management plans and other information with patients
Demonstrate skills in managing and evaluating patients with gynaecological problems, burns, those who have had reconstructive surgery
aim: PST502 is a clinical posting designed to provide students with practical experience in working with obstetric and gynaecological patients as well as patients who have undergone reconstructive surgery. Students will learn to instruct pregnant women in appropriate exercises before and after childbirth. Additionally, students will develop skills in history taking, physical examination, assessment procedures, clinical reasoning, and making clinical judgments for patients with gynaecological problems, burns, and those who have had reconstructive surgery. Furthermore, students will learn effective communication of treatment plans and management with patients and gain proficiency in managing and evaluating patients in these clinical settings.

topics: Physiotherapy posting in Paediatics - 8 days

Physiotherapy posting in Neuromedicine - 8 days

objectives: Demonstrate skills in managing and evaluating patients in various clinical settings
Demonstrate effective communication of management plans and information with patients
Demonstrate proficiency in clinical reasoning and making clinical judgments
Demonstrate comprehensive history taking, physical examination, and relevant assessment procedures for patients in various clinical settings
aim: PST503 is a summative clinical posting that provides students with the opportunity to integrate and apply the knowledge and skills acquired in previous courses to various clinical settings. Students will rotate through different clinical areas, including Paediatrics, Orthopaedics, Neuromedicine, Neurosurgery, General & Cardiothoracic Surgery, and Oncology, as well as Obstetrics & Gynaecology and Reconstructive Surgery. By the end of the posting, students will have demonstrated proficiency in managing and evaluating patients, effective communication of management plans, clinical reasoning, making clinical judgments, and conducting comprehensive history taking, physical examination, and relevant assessment procedures in different clinical settings.

objectives: 12 weeks SIWES training program in various clinical settings
aim: The aim of the SIWES program is to provide students with practical experience in a clinical setting. Students will spend 6 weeks in a clinical environment where they will have the opportunity to apply the knowledge and skills they have acquired in the classroom to real-life situations. By the end of the program, students will have gained valuable experience that will help them in their future careers as physiotherapists.

topics: Assessment, management, and evaluation of lesions within the spinal column (paraplegia, quadriplegia, Tabes dorsalis)
Assessment, management, and evaluation of neuropathies (myelinopathy, axonopathy) such as multiple sclerosis and Guillain-Barre Syndrome
Assessment, management, and evaluation of Syringomyelia
Assessment, management, and evaluation of neuromuscular junction disorders (Myasthenia gravis)
Assessment, management, and evaluation of metabolic neuropathy
Assessment, management, and evaluation of cranial nerve injuries and Motor neurone disorders
Assessment, management, and evaluation of neurological complications of infectious diseases e.g., HIV/AIDS
Assistive devices in neurological rehabilitation
Community re-integration of neurological ill patients
objectives: Describe the etiology, pathological basis, and clinical features of neurological conditions listed in the course content
Outline treatment plans for the neurological conditions listed in the course content
aim: PST512 is a course focusing on advancing students' knowledge and skills in neurology. It covers the assessment, management, and evaluation of various neurological conditions, including spinal column lesions, neuropathies, neuromuscular junction disorders, cranial nerve injuries, motor neurone disorders, and neurological complications of infectious diseases. Students will also learn about assistive devices in neurological rehabilitation and the community re-integration of neurological ill patients.

objectives: Identify a research problem

Present a seminar on an identified research problem
aim: PST513, Research Proposal Seminar, aims to equip students with the skills necessary for developing and presenting a research proposal. Throughout the course, students will learn how to identify research problems, review relevant literature, define research objectives, and describe the design and methods for investigating the identified research problem. By the end of the course, students will be able to present a seminar on their identified research problem.

aim: PST514, Physiotherapy in Intensive Care and Acute Care, aims to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary for managing critically ill patients in intensive care units and patients in acute care settings. The course covers assessment procedures for critically ill patients, differentiation between acute and intensive care physiotherapy, precautionary and safety measures, management of post-surgical patients, importance of early mobilization, and common problems encountered in intensive care units.

aim: PST515, Physiotherapy in Geriatrics, aims to equip students with the knowledge and skills necessary for providing effective care to elderly patients. The course covers theories of ageing, physiological effects of ageing, common disorders in the elderly, evaluation methods, management approaches, safety issues, challenges for physiotherapists in an ageing population, challenges of caring for the elderly in Nigeria, comparison of home care versus institutional care, and the importance of interdisciplinary approach in geriatric care.

aim: PST516, Ergonomics & Workplace Physiotherapy, aims to provide students with knowledge and skills related to ergonomics in the workplace and its relevance to occupational health physiotherapy practice. The course covers topics such as the definition and goal of ergonomics, human-machine systems, basic body mechanics, musculoskeletal problems, anthropometric principles, types of office chairs, ergonomic adaptation, and occupational health physiotherapy.

aim: PST517, Principles of Management for Physiotherapy, aims to equip students with the knowledge and skills necessary for effective management in physiotherapy practice. The course covers topics such as Nigerian healthcare policy, physiotherapy practice in Nigeria, principles of management, personnel management, conflict resolution, fiscal management, operations management, estates planning, ethical principles, healthcare marketing, and establishment and operation of a private physiotherapy practice.

aim: PST518, Disability Issues, aims to provide students with an understanding of the various issues faced by people with long-term disabilities and their families in social and cultural contexts. The course covers topics such as common causes of long-term disabilities, psychosocial issues, care settings, participation in society, policies and advocacies related to disability, and a comparison of disability issues in Nigeria and other parts of the world.

aim: PST521, Physiotherapy in Women's Health, aims to equip students with the knowledge and skills to provide physiotherapeutic care to women across various stages of life, with a focus on pregnancy, childbirth, and gynecological issues. The course covers topics such as prenatal care, pain relief in labor, postnatal care, complications of labor requiring physiotherapy, gynecological conditions, and precautionary measures in exercise during pregnancy and after childbirth.

aim: PST522, Terminal Illness & Palliative Care, aims to provide students with an understanding of terminal illnesses and the principles of palliative care. The course covers various topics such as common health problems in terminally ill patients, pain control, pharmacologic management of cancer pain, ethical issues, and the role of physiotherapy in the care of terminally ill patients. Additionally, it addresses communication skills, spiritual support, and bereavement in palliative care, as well as the landscape of palliative care organizations in Nigeria and Africa.

aim: PST523, Community-Based Physiotherapy & Primary Care Physiotherapy, aims to equip students with knowledge and skills relevant to providing physiotherapy services in community and primary care settings. The course covers the differences between community-based and hospital-based services, the philosophy of Primary Health Care, and the state of physiotherapy services in Nigeria. Additionally, it addresses principles of health education and screening, establishment of physiotherapy clinics in communities, itinerant and domiciliary services, and the philosophy of Community-Based Rehabilitation (CBR).

topics: Research Project

aim: PST524, Research Project, aims to provide students with the opportunity to conduct independent research on a topic of interest within the field of physiotherapy. Throughout the course, students will identify a research problem, review relevant literature, define research objectives, describe the design and methods for investigating the research problem, conduct research, and present their findings. By the end of the course, students will have developed research skills and contributed to the body of knowledge in physiotherapy.
